trans-unit.source: Represents a control for viewing flow content in a fixed viewing mode that shows content one page at a time.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer> allows only one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FlowDocument> as a child element.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer> shows content in page-at-a-time viewing mode.
A similar control, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer>, shows content in continuous scrolling mode.
Both <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer> are fixed to a particular viewing mode.

On the other hand, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentReader> includes features that enable the user to dynamically choose between various viewing modes (as provided by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentReaderViewingMode> enumeration), at the cost of being poorer performing than <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer> or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer>.
The following illustration shows a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer> control with its default [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)].
![Screenshot: FlowDocumentPageViewer](~/add/media/flowdocpageviewer-main.png "Screenshot: FlowDocumentPageViewer")

**Content Area** - The content area displays the contents of the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FlowDocument> specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.Document%2A> property.
**Toolbar** - The default toolbar is docked underneath the content area, and hosts controls for navigating pages, and changing the zoom level.

**Page Navigation Controls** - The page navigation controls include a button to jump to the next page (the down arrow) or previous page (the up arrow), as well as indicators for the current page number and total number of pages.
**Zoom Controls** - The zoom controls enable the user to increase or decrease the zoom level by clicking the plus or minus buttons, respectively.
The zoom controls also include a slider for adjusting the zoom level.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentReader.Zoom%2A>.

**Search** - The user can use the Ctr+F keyboard shortcut or you can use <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.Find%2A> to toggle a search textbox that is used to find strings within the content.
See <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.Find%2A> for more information.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer"></xref> class.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.Zoom"></xref> level can be decreased.

Calling the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.DecreaseZoom%2A> method decreases the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.Zoom%2A> level by the amount specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.ZoomIncrement%2A> property.
The value of this property is subject to the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.MinZoom%2A> property.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.Zoom"></xref> level can be decreased; otherwise, `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.CanDecreaseZoom"></xref> dependency property.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.CanDecreaseZoom"></xref> dependency property.

If you derive from <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer>, you need this key in order to set the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.CanDecreaseZoom%2A> dependency property.

Call <xref:System.Windows.DependencyObject.SetValue%28System.Windows.DependencyPropertyKey%2CSystem.Object%29>, passing <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.CanDecreaseZoomPropertyKey> as the `key` parameter.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.Zoom"></xref> level can be increased.

Calling the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.IncreaseZoom%2A> method increases the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.Zoom%2A> level by the amount specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.ZoomIncrement%2A> property.
The value of this property is subject to the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.MaxZoom%2A> property.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.Zoom"></xref> level can be increased; otherwise, `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.CanIncreaseZoom"></xref> dependency property.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.CanIncreaseZoom"></xref> dependency property.

If you derive from <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer>, you need this key in order to set the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.CanIncreaseZoom%2A> dependency property.

Call <xref:System.Windows.DependencyObject.SetValue%28System.Windows.DependencyPropertyKey%2CSystem.Object%29>, passing <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.CanIncreaseZoomPropertyKey> as the `key` parameter.
Executes the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.DecreaseZoom"></xref> routed command.

This method decreases the current <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.Zoom%2A> level by the value specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.ZoomIncrement%2A> property.
Default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer>[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)] includes a button to decrease the zoom.
Calling this method has no effect if the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.CanDecreaseZoom%2A> property returns `false`.
Toggles the **Find** dialog.
By default, Ctrl+F provides a keyboard shortcut for toggling the **Find** dialog.
The following figure shows the **Find** dialog on a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer> with default UI.
![Screenshot: Find Dialog of FlowDocumentPageViewer](~/add/media/flowdocpageviewer-find.png "Screenshot: Find Dialog of FlowDocumentPageViewer")
The default **Find** dialog includes a field for entering search text, as well as buttons for **Find Next**, **Find Previous**, and **Options**.
The following **Find** options are provided by default:
Match whole word only
Match case
Match diacritic
Match kashida
Match alef hamza
Executes the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.IncreaseZoom"></xref> routed command.

This method increases the current <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.Zoom%2A> level by the value specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.ZoomIncrement%2A> property.
Default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer>[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)] includes a button to increase the zoom.
Calling this method has no effect if the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.CanIncreaseZoom%2A> property returns `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer"></xref> displays selected text when the control does not have focus.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None

`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer"></xref> displays selected text when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer"></xref> does not have focus; otherwise, `false`.
The registered default is `false`.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.IsInactiveSelectionHighlightEnabled"></xref> dependency property.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer"></xref> has focus and selected text.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer"></xref> displays selected text when the text box does not have focus; otherwise, `false`.
The registered default is `false`.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.IsSelectionActive"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the maximum allowable <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.Zoom"></xref> level for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer"></xref>.

The default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer> [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)] includes a slider that can be used to adjust the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.Zoom%2A> level.
This property specifies the upper-limit value for the slider.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The maximum allowable zoom level for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer"></xref>, interpreted as a percentage.
The default is 200.0 (a maximum zoom of 200%).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.MaxZoom"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the minimum allowable <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.Zoom"></xref> level for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer"></xref>.

The default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer> [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)] includes a slider that can be used to adjust the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.Zoom%2A> level.
This property specifies the lower-limit value for the slider.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The minimum allowable zoom level for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer"></xref>, interpreted as a percentage.
The default is 80.0 (a minimum zoom of 80%).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.MinZoom"></xref> dependency property.
Builds the visual tree for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer"></xref>.
This method is called whenever <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ApplyTemplate%2A> is called.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.OnApplyTemplate%2A>.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.ApplicationCommands.CancelPrint"></xref> routed command.
This method is called when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.ApplicationCommands.CancelPrint%2A> command is called.
Called whenever an unhandled <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ContextMenuOpening"></xref> routed event reaches this class in its route.
Implement this method to add class handling for this event.
This method has no default implementation.
You should still call the base implementation in case an intermediate class in the inheritance has implemented this method.

The purpose of this method is somewhat similar to [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On* methods: it provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes with a class handler instead of an instance handler.
In this case, the matching event is a routed event.

The implementation pattern of the On* methods is different for routed events because the routed event might have been raised by a child element, not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers, so your implementation will need to take the event arguments' source properties into account (and should not try to re-raise the event in most cases).
Subclasses of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer> could call private class handler methods when the event is received along the route.
One potential scenario is to take the arguments of the event and deliberately mark the event as handled.
Arguments of the event.

Provides an appropriate <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> implementation for this control, as part of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] automation infrastructure.
The appropriate <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> implementation for this control.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.DecreaseZoom"></xref> routed command.
This method is called when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.DecreaseZoom%2A> command is called.
Called when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.Document"></xref> property is changed.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.OnDocumentChanged%2A>.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.ApplicationCommands.Find"></xref> routed command.
This method is called when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.ApplicationCommands.Find%2A> command is called.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.FirstPage"></xref> routed command.
This method is called when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.FirstPage%2A> command is called.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.OnFirstPageCommand%2A>.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.GoToPage"></xref> routed command.
This method is called when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.GoToPage%2A> command is called.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.OnGoToPageCommand%2A>.
The page number to go to.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.IncreaseZoom"></xref> routed command.
This method is called when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.IncreaseZoom%2A> command is called.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.KeyDown"></xref> routed event.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.OnKeyDown%2A>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Input.KeyEventArgs"></xref> object that contains the arguments associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.KeyDown"></xref> routed event.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.LastPage"></xref> routed command.
This method is called when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.LastPage%2A> command is called.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.OnLastPageCommand%2A>.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.MouseWheel"></xref> routed event.
This method is called whenever the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.MouseWheel> routed event is raised.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.OnMouseWheel%2A>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Input.MouseWheelEventArgs"></xref> object containing arguments associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.MouseWheel"></xref> routed event.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.NextPage"></xref> routed command.
This method is called when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.NextPage%2A> command is called.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.OnNextPageCommand%2A>.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.PageViewsChanged"></xref> routed event.
This method is called whenever the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.PageViewsChanged> routed event is raised.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.OnPageViewsChanged%2A>.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.PreviousPage"></xref> routed command.
This method is called when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.PreviousPage%2A> command is called.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.OnPreviousPageCommand%2A>.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.ApplicationCommands.Print"></xref> routed command.
This method is called when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.ApplicationCommands.Print%2A> command is called.
Called when a printing job has completed.
Gets the selected content of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer"></xref>.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.Selection%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
The selected content of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer"></xref>.
Gets or sets the brush that highlights the selected text.

You can specify the brush that highlights selected text in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer> by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.SelectionBrush%2A> and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.SelectionOpacity%2A> properties..
A brush that highlights the selected text.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.SelectionBrush"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the opacity of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.SelectionBrush"></xref>.

If you set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.SelectionOpacity%2A> to 0, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.SelectionBrush%2A> is transparent and is not visible.

If you set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.SelectionOpacity%2A> to 1.0 or greater, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.SelectionBrush%2A> is opaque and the selected text is not visible.
The opacity of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.SelectionBrush"></xref>.
The default is 0.4.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.SelectionOpacity"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the current zoom level for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer"></xref>.
The zoom level is constrained by the values of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.MinZoom%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.MaxZoom%2A> properties.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The current zoom level, interpreted as a percentage.
The default is 100.0 (a zoom level of 100%).
Gets or sets the zoom increment.

The zoom increment is the percentage by which the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.Zoom%2A> level is increased or decreased when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.IncreaseZoom%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.DecreaseZoom%2A> commands are executed, respectively.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The current zoom increment, interpreted as a percentage.
The default is 10.0 (zoom increments by 10%).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.ZoomIncrement"></xref> dependency property.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer.Zoom"></xref> dependency property.
